goal.ch: 我們為甚麼會思考哲學問題？何謂哲學？何為哲學的內容、亦即甚麼是哲學所探討的對象？哲學如何探究各式各樣不同的現象與問題？本課程旨在從系統的分科方式來介紹西方哲學問題的性質與類別。
goal.en: Why do we philosophize? What is philosophy? What are the contents, namely the objects of philosophy? How does philosophy investigate diverse phenomena and problems? This course tries to introduce the character and issues of Western Philosophy in a systematic way.

outline.ch:
09.16. 課程說明；  Chap.1何謂哲學？*
09.23. Chap.3, §1-,  形上學(I)：哲學的性質、萌芽與發展*
09.30. Chap.3, §1-,  形上學(II)：哲學的性質、萌芽與發展*
10.07. Chap.2, §1-2, 知識論(I)：笛卡兒、萊布尼茲與理性主義
10.14. Chap.2, §3-5, 知識論(II)：休謨與經驗主義、康德的批判哲學
10.21. Chap.3, §2-,  心靈哲學：霍布斯唯物論、自由意志與決定論、心物問題
10.28. Chap.4, §1-4, 科學哲學：培根、孔恩等的科學哲學理論
11.04. 期中考
11.11. Chap.5, §1-3, 倫理學(I)：康德之義務論
11.18. Chap.5, §4-7, 倫理學(II)：效益主義、德行倫理學、應用倫理學─醫療倫理學
11.25. Chap.6, §1-2, 社會哲學：彌爾與自由主義、馬克思的社會主義
12.02. Chap.6, §3-5, 政治哲學：盧梭與社會契約論、多元主義國家論
12.09. Chap.7, §1-4, 藝術哲學：柏拉圖、亞里斯多德、托爾斯泰、馬庫色
12.16. Chap.8, §2-5, 宗教哲學(I)：言談宗教之可能性、上帝存在的證明
12.23. Chap.8, §1,6, 宗教哲學(II)：惡的難題與齊克果對信仰的遭遇
12.30. 期末考
01.06. 自主學習
01.13. 自主學習
課程要求：課前閱讀、重構論證、準備問題、參與討論、撰寫報告
outline.en:
09.16. Course Description; Chap.1, What is Philosophy? *
09.23. Chap.3, §1-, Metaphysics (I): Philosophy’s property, beginning, and development*
09.30. Chap.3, §1-, Metaphysics (II): (continued)*
10.07. Chap.2, §1-2, Epistemology (I): Descartes, Leibniz, and Rationalism
10.14. Chap.2, §3-5, Epistemology (II): Hume and Empiricism
10.21. Chap.3, §2-4, Philosophy of Mind: Hobbes’s materialism, Free will and Determinism, Mind-body problem
10.28. Chap.4, §1-6, Philosophy of science：Bacon, Kuhn and theories of philosophy of science
11.04. Midterm exam
11.11. Chap.5, §1-3, Ethics (I): Kant’s Deontology
11.18. Chap.5, §4-7, Ethics (II): Utilitarianism, Virtue Ethics, and Applied Ethics: Ethics of Medicine
11.25. Chap.6, §1-2, Social Philosophy: Mill and Liberalism, Marx’s Socialism
12.02. Chap.6, §3-5, Political Philosophy: Rousseau and Social Contract, Plural theory of State
12.09.  Chap.7, §1-4, Philosophy of Art: Plato and Aristotle, Tolstoy, and Marcuse
12.16. Chap.8, §2-5, Philosophy of Religion (I): Possibility of speaking about religion, Proofs of God’s Existence
12.23. Chap.8, §1, 6, Philosophy of Religion (II): Problems of Evil and Kierkegaard’s encounter with Faith
12.30. Final exam
01.06. Self-directed Learning
01.13. Self-directed Learning
Demand of Seminar: Reading Texts, Reconstructing Arguments, Preparing Questions, Engaging in Discussion, Writing Paper.“
